bug.author: convoliution
bug.summary: spaCy v2.3.1 can't be imported in Python 2.7
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
python2 -m pip install spaCy==2.3.1 python2 -c "import spacy" results in vocab.pyx:18: in init spacy.vocab ??? E File "/home/travis/build/explosion/spaCy/spacy/lemmatizer.py", line 24 E def __init__(self, lookups, *args, is_base_form=None, **kwargs): E ^ E SyntaxError: invalid syntax spaCy's Python 2.7 build pipeline on Travis <denchmark-link:https://travis-ci.org/github/explosion/spaCy/builds/706096302>is failing with the same error</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: macOS Python Version Used: spaCy Version Used: 2.3.1 Environment Information: clean environment

comments.comment: Thanks for the report! We'll get this fixed for the next release, v2.3.2.
